sentence.Network_en: McGrath remembers his offbeat sense of humor, his whimsical side.
sentence.Network_cn: 麦格拉思记得他不同寻常的幽默感和他古怪的一面。

sentence.Network_en: The essays could do with a flash of wit or humor.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些散文需要一些出其不意的风趣或幽默。

sentence.Network_en: I think humor is a great lubricant for life.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为幽默是人生的上好润滑剂。

list.abs: 房水（aqueous humor）为充盈于眼房中的无色透明流动液体。眼房分前房与后房。
2003年3月13日 - 由于眼睛中的排水系统构造遭到破坏,无法正常的把水样液(aqueous humor)液体排出眼球外,因此会造成眼压上升。虽然PCG的发生机率大概只有万分之一,但是一旦.
黑色幽默（black humor）（Black Humor）黑色幽默（black humor）不同于一般幽默的地方在于，它的荒诞不经、冷嘲热讽、玩世不恭之中包含了沉重和苦闷、眼泪和 …

encyclopedia.content: 发音 英音：['hju:mə] 美音：['hjumɚ] 词典解释名词 n. 1.幽默感[U] 2.幽默[U] Humor is often more than a laughing matter. 幽默常常不只是一笑了之的事。 He has a good sense of humor. 他富于幽默感。 3.心情，情绪[S] The boss is in no humor to talk to you right now. 此刻老板没有心情同你说话。 4.气质，性情[U] 及物动词 vt. 1. 迎合；迁就 It's not always wise to humor a small child. 迁就小孩

means.word_mean: 1. a message whose ingenuity or verbal skill or incongruity has the power to evoke laughter
2. the trait of appreciating (and being able to express) the humorous;

sentences.sentence: "you can't survive in the army without a sense of humor"

means.word_mean: 3. a characteristic (habitual or relatively temporary) state of feeling;

sentences.sentence: "whether he praised or cursed me depended on his temper at the time"
"I fail to see the humor in it"

means.word_mean: 5. (Middle Ages) one of the four fluids in the body whose balance was believed to determine your emotional and physical state;

sentences.sentence: "the humors are blood and phlegm and yellow and black bile"

means.word_mean: 6. the liquid parts of the body

Sentence.sentence: It adds to the humor of the text
In to day's personality stakes, nothing is more highly valued than the sense of humor.
This attitude would have surprised the ancient Greeks,who believed humor to be essentially aggressive
